page.title: 08Customs in Malhamdale
page.content: Customs connected with{Kirkby Malham {Church}include beating the parish bounds,and distributing the Poor Share.This is a piece of land which was donated to the church about 250 years ago.It is let on a yearly basis,and the proceeds are given to the poor of the parish. Rogation Sunday is still celebrated when all the churches of the dale,of all denominations,meet to bless the land and ask for its fruitfulness. When there is a wedding at the church,the children of the dale tie up the lych-gates,and the best-man must throw money over the gates to persuade the children to let them out. Every June,sports are held in{Hanlith {Park}followed by a party tea for the children in{Kirkby Malham Village {Hall. }
